[<System.AttributeUsage(System.AttributeTargets.Assembly | System.AttributeTargets.Class | System.AttributeTargets.Constructor | System.AttributeTargets.Enum | System.AttributeTargets.Event | System.AttributeTargets.Field | System.AttributeTargets.Interface | System.AttributeTargets.Method | System.AttributeTargets.Module | System.AttributeTargets.Property | System.AttributeTargets.Struct, AllowMultiple=true, Inherited=false)>]

Docs.summary: Marks APIs that were obsoleted in a given operating system version.
Docs.remarks: Primarily used by OS bindings to indicate APIs that should not be used anymore.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(string platformName) cil managed

Docs.param: The obsoleted OS platform name, optionally including a version.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class for the specified obsoleted OS platform.

Public Sub New (platformName As String, message As String)

Docs.param: The obsoleted OS platform name, optionally including a version.
Additional information about the obsoletion, for example, a suggested alternative for the obsoleted API.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the attribute class for the specified obsoleted OS platform with an additional message.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property Message As String
public: property System::String ^ Message { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the optional additional message provided for the attribute.
Docs.value: A string that represents the message, or if there is none.
Docs.remarks: Provides additional information about the obsoleted API, often to suggest a better alternative to use on the specified OS platform.
